'''Minecraft Monument Challenge''' is a free [[Marketplace]] map created in partnership with the {{wikipedia|The Nature Conservancy}} during [[15 Days of Minecraft#May_28|Day 14]] for ''Minecraft''<nowiki/>'s 15th Anniversary, promoting a competition where players can create their own build to be featured in a [[Minecraft National Park|forthcoming map]]. The ultimate winner of the contest is [https://www.youtube.com/@GuilleAnimations GuilleAnimations], who constructed a statue of an [[axolotl]].<ref>{{Mcnet|the-minecraft-national-park|The Minecraft National Park|October 30, 2024|Per Landin}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{Cite Instagram|galioanimations_yt|C7tcohEI2PW|#minecraftmonumentchallenge24|June 2, 2024}}</ref>

== Summary ==
Unique to this map, it's set inside of another map, under construction. The player will spawn inside a vacant building in [[Creative mode]], with two signs and floating, sparkling arrows pointing towards a [[chest]]. Inside the chest are nine copies of a "rule [[book]]" item, which contains the following text, giving rules on the competition similar those on the signs.

{{Collapse
|content=
Are you ready for a blockstastic adventure? The {{Font color|#FFAA00|Minecraft Monument Challenge}} is here!<br>
The contest starts on {{Font color|#FFAA00|May 27, 2024}} and ends on {{Font color|#FFAA00|July 27, 2024}}. To enter, you must be a legal resident of a country where Minecraft is officially sold and be ten (10) or older. To enter, you must create a build in [[Minecraft: Bedrock Edition]] using the provided template map and resources, create a video of the build, and publish a publicly viewable post on that includes a link to your video on X/Twitter, Youtube, TikTok, or Instagram with the Challenge hashtag {{Font color|#FFAA00|#MinecraftMonument}}.<br>
The entry limit is one {{Font color|#FFAA00|(1)}} per person, so make it count! The Grand Prize winner's build will be included in the Minecraft National Park Map. So, put on your creative hat, grab your [[pickaxe]], and get building!<br>
And if you want to see who won, just send an email to {{Font color|#FFAA00|NationalParkContest@mojang.com}} with the subject line {{Font color|#FFAA00|"Minecraft Monument Challenge winners"}} within 30-days of September 30, 2024 to receive a list of winners.<br>
For more information about the contest, check out these links!<br>
{{Font color|#FFAA00|https://aka.ms/MinecraftMonumentRules}}<br>
{{Font color|#FFAA00|https://aka.ms/MinecraftNationalPark}}<br>
Good luck, and may the best builder win!<br>
{{Font color|#FF5454|^^^}} Scroll to the top {{Font color|#FF5454|^^^}}
}}

Behind the chest is a path made of [[concrete]], [[moss blocks]], and [[concrete powder]] which leads to a [[mud brick]] fountain. outside, where the player may notice that the map is an incomplete, floating island. Behind the fountain is a [[diorite]] rock with visible [[scaffolding]] and floating [[cobblestone]] spelling out ''Under Construction''. A similar installation can be found to the left, next to an unfinished pavilion, behind the path, next to a large, stylized [[tree]], and to the right. Next to the right rock is a large [[tuff]] podium, labeled ''BUILD HERE!'' and marked with [[creeper]] faces. Inside a dotted outline made of [[concrete|yellow concrete]] and below arrows outlined with [[sea lanterns]], the player will find a [[beacon]] powered by [[blocks of diamond]], marked with [[signs|bamboo signs]] instructing the player to remove the beacon.

From there, the player is allowed to build whatever they desire.
